Definition.WordDefinition: Ilion, NY (village, FIPS 37275) Location: 43.01120 N, 75.04071 W Population (1990): 8888 (3586 housing units) Area: 6.4 sq km (land), 0.1 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 13357

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ilion \Ilion\ prop. n. Ilium, or Troy, the ancient city in Asia Minor that was the site of the Trojan War; -- a variant spelling of {Ilium}.
Syn: Troy, Ilium. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ilium \Il"i*um\, n. [See {Ileum}.] (Anat.) The dorsal one of the three principal bones comprising either lateral half of the pelvis; the dorsal or upper part of the hip bone. See {Innominate bone}, under {Innominate}. [Written also {ilion}, and {ileum}.] [1913 Webster]
Ilion n : an ancient city in Asia Minor that was the site of the Trojan War [syn: {Troy}, {Ilium}]
